{{also|test|TEST|țest}} ==English== ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|cricket}} (sometimes [[test]]) a [[Test match]] ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun}} # A [[river]] in [[Hampshire]], England, which empties into the [[Solent]] near [[Southampton]]. ====Derived terms==== * {{l|en|Test Valley}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=estt|TETS|TETs|sett|stet|tets}} [[Category:en:Rivers in England]] ---- ==German== {{wikipedia|lang=de}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/tɛst/|[tɛst]}} * {{audio|de|De-Test.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|de|ɛst}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{der|de|en|test}}, from {{der|de|fro|test||pot; melting pot, especially one in which metals were tried}}, from {{der|de|la|testum||pot}}. Compare etymology 2 below. The development from “melting pot” to “procedure of testing metals” also happened natively in earlier German, but the further generalisation is exclusively English. ====Noun==== {{de-noun|m|Tests|gen2=Testes|Tests|pl2=Teste|Testchen}} # [[test]] =====Usage notes===== * The commoner plural is '''''Tests'''''. The form ''Teste'' is chiefly colloquial. =====Declension===== {{de-decl-noun-m|s|s}} {{de-decl-noun-m|es|e}} =====Hyponyms===== {{col4|de|Abreißtest|Abschlusstest|Abwurftest|Achievementtest|AIDS-Test
